channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Drain cover sunk making noise when cars drive over it, 20th March
item.description:
This road has just been resurfaced. It is a problem when cars drive over the drain /man hole cover. The cars lower when they go over it so, it either has not been done properly in the first place or it has sunk. The noise is unbearable living by it. Do not say it has been inspected and it is fine because it isn’t.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 206, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Swindon Farm access road has been damaged by earth moving equipment leading to waterlogged right of way. This appears to be ongoing with no planning application to permit this blocking of access

item.title: Sort out the temporary lights, 20th March
item.description:
Shouldn’t take 1 hour to go 1 mile through the village to take child to school
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 397-399, Innsworth Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary lights shocking, 20th March
item.description:
Hare & hound cross roads. Road works are creating standstill traffic back to Innsworth farm house as well as Standstill back to the A40 and into longlevens. Taking 1hr 15 minutes to get 1.8miles to take my child to school in the morning is frankly shameful! Traffic signals are not going in any particular order, are not allowing enough cars through each time. Work men/women have already left at 5am so why is the road shut until 6am. Maybe if they completed a full shift it would be done quicker? 7 ambulances lined up in the traffic heading back to depot sat there for 30 minutes, 2 fire engines on a shout struggling to get through the traffic. Police stuck in the traffic delaying them. How is this good planning, how is this acceptable? Whoever is responsible for planning really needs addressing. All for a cycle path that’s already in such a poor state or repair and not being used by cyclists due to this?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parton Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Shabby repair, 20th March
item.description:
Enquiry 22042399 Pothole outside 6 Hamilton St previously reported twice! Men arrived to repair at 5.50pm this evening. We’re here about 10 minutes. They have simply filled in the hole leaving cracks either side and didn’t bother to clear up all the rubble from the hole that is lying in the gutter!! VERY POOR REPAIR and total waste of time because it will be crumbling either side very soon.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 147, Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The Cotswold Oak building site entrance is causing a huge amount of us right across the road. This morning four Lorrie’s were entering/exiting the site causing even more mud to be spread across the carriageway. Many local residents are concerned about this ongoing problem. I understood that developers have a responsibility for keeping the access and egress to their site in good order., 20th March
item.description:
The development site Cotswold Oak situated at the corner of Stoke Road and Tredington Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
